revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 02:30:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/test_authorization.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_list_images.py', 'tempest/cmd/cleanup_service.py', 'tempest/common/waiters.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_list_server_filters.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_image_metadata.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_list_image_filters.py', 'tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_get.py', 'tempest/scenario/utils.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py', 'tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver.py'], 'message': "Return complete response from compute images_client

Currently compute images_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['image'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute images_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I57818ccf8d0f6a631223a240b20829e5c40c3e6d
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib
"}]
commit_message:
Return complete response from compute images_client

Currently compute images_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['image'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute images_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I57818ccf8d0f6a631223a240b20829e5c40c3e6d
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-25 23:30:24.000000000', 'files': ['etc/os-brick/rootwrap.d/os-brick.filters', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Add rootwrap filters

This patch adds os-bricks list of rootwrap filters for commands
that are needed to execute.   The filters are a self contained entire
list of expected filters that os-brick needs to run.  It's expected that
this filter file is added to any rootwrap enabled service that needs to use
os-brick.

Devstack associated patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207677/

Partial-Bug: #1479842
UpgradeImpact:  Need to place the os-brick.filters file in service's
                rootwrap.d directory to enable filters.

Change-Id: I2b1e657b87c7b27548200a20b991f34c3413c24b
"}]
commit_message:
Add rootwrap filters

This patch adds os-bricks list of rootwrap filters for commands
that are needed to execute.   The filters are a self contained entire
list of expected filters that os-brick needs to run.  It's expected that
this filter file is added to any rootwrap enabled service that needs to use
os-brick.

Devstack associated patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207677/

Partial-Bug: #1479842
UpgradeImpact:  Need to place the os-brick.filters file in service's
                rootwrap.d directory to enable filters.

Change-Id: I2b1e657b87c7b27548200a20b991f34c3413c24b

commit_message:
Allowing data sources to be edited

Adding a table row option to be able to edit a given
data source object.  Also adding a couple of tests that go
along with data source creation and editing.

Change-Id: Ic41bc3355973f3dd7e2b171b979776dbbeaa1731
Implements: bp allow-editing-of-data-sources

commit_message:
Fix backwards compatibility on class Root

- Added create and is_root_enabled back into Root
  to maintain backwards compatibility of API.
- Methods just call into the new create_instance_root
  and is_instance_root_enabled methods.

Change-Id: I8ea0e82cd800fe229e8224372bd8edc6c82bf8c4

ceilometer-zvm is a new project that integrates zvm with OpenStack
Ceilometer. It will mainly implements zvm specific inspector, to
make Ceilometer compute agent work with zvm hypervisor.

Enable access of creating tags and branches, for the purpose of
release management.

Change-Id: I50084a4e929672ea5cf105599e740bf5d9cd1423
'}]
commit_message:
Create new project ceilometer-zvm on stackforge

ceilometer-zvm is a new project that integrates zvm with OpenStack
Ceilometer. It will mainly implements zvm specific inspector, to
make Ceilometer compute agent work with zvm hypervisor.

Enable access of creating tags and branches, for the purpose of
release management.

Change-Id: I50084a4e929672ea5cf105599e740bf5d9cd1423

commit_message:
Enable HAProxy Stats Web UI

This patch enables the HAProxy webstats for all the configures
backends and frontends.

A password entry is added to user_secrets.yml for the webstats
password.

It also adds variables for port number, username and password
which can be overridden in user_variables.yml appropriately.

Change-Id: Iec866ad124bec6fb0b8524a966adf64e22422035
Closes-Bug: #1446432
(cherry picked from commit 79e55616aafc25ff8084a43c4938a4ede4344bb7)

commit_message:
Fix format errors of subheading

'Identity' is an independent OpenStack dashboard which is at the
same level with both 'Project tab' and 'Admin tab', not a category
under 'Admin tab'

Also, remove these repetitions: ":guilabel:`Project` tab" and
":guilabel:`Admin` tab"

commit_message:

keystoneauth does not support translation and therefore the plugins
should not require/utilize the translation strings either.

subject: Add a new method validate_raid_config to RAIDInterface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 17:35:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/ironic-generic-raid-interface.rst'], 'message': "Add a new method validate_raid_config to RAIDInterface

The new method is required because it can be called from
API synchronously to validate the target RAID configuration
before accepting it. The new method explicitly for validating
target RAID configuration, instead of validate() method, makes
sure that we throw an error only if validation of target
RAID configuration fails (validate() method might be validating
other things also like BMC's credentials).

Change-Id: I5903e1f99bb9ebb3ea546c013e5fefa7115060b6
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new method validate_raid_config to RAIDInterface

The new method is required because it can be called from
API synchronously to validate the target RAID configuration
before accepting it. The new method explicitly for validating
target RAID configuration, instead of validate() method, makes
sure that we throw an error only if validation of target
RAID configuration fails (validate() method might be validating
other things also like BMC's credentials).

Change-Id: I5903e1f99bb9ebb3ea546c013e5fefa7115060b6

build environment variables like HTTP_PROXY if the latter were
used during build.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-proxy-to-dockerfiles

commit_message:
Remove rpmbuild directory

The spec files in the rpmbuild directory are very old, and have been
superseded by Greg Swift's work to get Barbican into Fedora.  Parties
interested in rpm packaging of Barbican should refer to Greg's GitHub
repository:

https://github.com/gregswift/barbican-spec

Change-Id: I62b14769574bd2d6662434fb20d75c0eadecccab

commit_message:
Install python-pymysql on Ubuntu

Note: this is a temporary fix and will be reverted once packaging is
fixed upstream.
python-pymysql is a new dependency in Liberty and current OpenStack
packages do not depend on it right now. It's work in progress by Ubuntu
team.

Change-Id: I8470fc063a881bfb523007927c8fd1890058bc91

commit_message:
add 'boot from ebs' scenario test

test that boots from a snapshot of a volume backed instance
(instance that was booted from bootable volume that was created from image).

Recent changes in nova and cinder broke booting from EBS instance.
For example last change in cinder is here
(that broke booting) - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182994/

Change-Id: I3915e2f04163568f758bb9e98bd5394af80aa431
Closes-Bug: #1485424

commit_message:
[Sahara] Added volume type and instance locality support

Adding ability:
* to specify volume_type
* to enable volume_local_to_instance function, which allows
volume and instance creation on the same physical host

partially implements bp: volume-instance-locality
Closes-Bug: #1369574

Change-Id: Ie682907e2cfe1fe4f00ceedd310ee0251348eba3

commit_message:
Update Table to Single HTML for Readability

The multiple table files actually made it more difficult to see
the whole picture of the table. You would have to have multiple files
open to correlate the column headers, column data, and details sections.

Future patches can add additional helper directives to simplify this
even further.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

Change-Id: Ic605b1d77b09a0444e38dbb31855f56ab59d399a
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Correct logging for volume disconnect

The volume disconnect code was logging the entire instance object when
the intent was to log just the name of the instance.  This change aligns
it with volume connect logging.

Change-Id: Ic408f3f486a16dee55b640ae1fcdda5a2aa48012

all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Use inifile for tempest_*_id_setter provider

The current (old) implementation can't work with current tempest, since
the parameter needs to be in a specific section (compute or network).
Let's refactor to use inifile like it should be done.

subject: Remove fixed interval looper to eventlet thread
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-26 23:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sea_agent.py', 'neutron_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sea_agent.py'], 'message': 'Remove fixed interval looper to eventlet thread

This change modifies the PVID Looper to use an eventlet based thread.
This resolves an excessive logging issue that could occur.

The previous mechanism would always run a new pass after 1 second -
regardless of if the previous loop had finished.  This would allow
multiple update requests to go through at once.  Subsequent runs could
actually send a failure request.

This change makes it so that only one loop pass can run at a time.  It
also adds some additional logging in the event of a failure to help
guide the admin to the root issue.

Change-Id: I9d5b0e023f91bbc3817ecbb6b395f5f6230214b7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove fixed interval looper to eventlet thread

This change modifies the PVID Looper to use an eventlet based thread.
This resolves an excessive logging issue that could occur.

The previous mechanism would always run a new pass after 1 second -
regardless of if the previous loop had finished.  This would allow
multiple update requests to go through at once.  Subsequent runs could
actually send a failure request.

This change makes it so that only one loop pass can run at a time.  It
also adds some additional logging in the event of a failure to help
guide the admin to the root issue.

Change-Id: I9d5b0e023f91bbc3817ecbb6b395f5f6230214b7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-27 14:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Accept removable block devices by PCI vendor ID

The issue is that, for particular raid controller obtaning vendor of
block device from sysfs attributes is not realible.

Once every raid controller is connected to PCI bus directly,
it's more realible to look at vendor ID of that controller to which
removable block device belongs.

For example, Adaptec is a perfect canditate to be added to a list of
removable PCI vendor IDs, since it's manufacturing RAID controllers
mostly.

Change-Id: Ib1018abbb46c65d909e594ad1d8921c8c5a139fc
Related-Bug: #1486601
"}]
commit_message:
Accept removable block devices by PCI vendor ID

The issue is that, for particular raid controller obtaning vendor of
block device from sysfs attributes is not realible.

Once every raid controller is connected to PCI bus directly,
it's more realible to look at vendor ID of that controller to which
removable block device belongs.

For example, Adaptec is a perfect canditate to be added to a list of
removable PCI vendor IDs, since it's manufacturing RAID controllers
mostly.

Change-Id: Ib1018abbb46c65d909e594ad1d8921c8c5a139fc
Related-Bug: #1486601

subject: In test_rest run process_measures after a request
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 14:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py'], 'message': 'In test_rest run process_measures after a request

When done before we are not guaranteeing that the request just made
is processed in a way that a subsequent assertion expects.

Presumably the previous way was done to say "make sure the previous
request was fully processed before doing this request, which is a
confirmation". However we have seen intermittent test failures where
expected measures are not present in result sets.

Change-Id: I67a0e24195b3fe2d8406495fedd072307b552990
'}]
commit_message:
In test_rest run process_measures after a request

When done before we are not guaranteeing that the request just made
is processed in a way that a subsequent assertion expects.

Presumably the previous way was done to say "make sure the previous
request was fully processed before doing this request, which is a
confirmation". However we have seen intermittent test failures where
expected measures are not present in result sets.

Change-Id: I67a0e24195b3fe2d8406495fedd072307b552990

of the UI can be built on top of this.

commit_message:
Unify Centos and Ubuntu Source Install - Nova

A change merged in the base allows for Centos and Ubuntu to install
all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I58708a4e7375f20622c944539a41336333d3bfcb
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu

subject: Fix amqp1 job in stable/kilo (2 backports)
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-27 15:41:30.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'amqp1-requirements.txt', 'setup.py', 'requirements-py3.txt', 'test-requirements-py3.txt', 'setup-test-env-qpid.sh', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/gate/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Fix amqp1 job in stable/kilo (2 backports)

This patch contains 2 backports from master. Unfortunately, an update on
f21 is forcing to update the requirements for amqp1. Therefore, we need
these 2 commits, which depend on each other, to be backported as one.

Commit 1:

Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

Commit 2:

Fix qpid's functional gate

The loggin verbosity changed in 0.32 which our gate is pulling from the
updates repository. This patch updates the script to make it work again.

Closes-bug: #1468917
Change-Id: I88a1bc794246beb156d4301bd503fa51a7cd2cce
(cherry picked from commit 079c04f0d06539f3507c772ccc68807a6d01a73a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix amqp1 job in stable/kilo (2 backports)

This patch contains 2 backports from master. Unfortunately, an update on
f21 is forcing to update the requirements for amqp1. Therefore, we need
these 2 commits, which depend on each other, to be backported as one.

Commit 1:

Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

Commit 2:

Fix qpid's functional gate

The loggin verbosity changed in 0.32 which our gate is pulling from the
updates repository. This patch updates the script to make it work again.

Closes-bug: #1468917
Change-Id: I88a1bc794246beb156d4301bd503fa51a7cd2cce
(cherry picked from commit 079c04f0d06539f3507c772ccc68807a6d01a73a)

subject: WIP: Fix py27 unittests in stable/kilo (2 backports)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 15:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/test_utils.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_opts.py'], 'message': "WIP: Fix py27 unittests in stable/kilo (2 backports)

Commit 1:

Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

Cherry-Picked from: 3d483fda709d2d04db2222e0119eaa54de5f5867

Commit 2:

Fix mock use for mock 1.1.0

Correct the way we check the calls by using the proper mock method. Add
a new test to expand coverage of the area being fixed.

Cherry-Picked from c7b31385ac3616060ef0f2188fb724191caad03c

Related-Bug: #1488456

Change-Id: I52dcf12be11bb57a47235735f7b46aafdf602261
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix py27 unittests in stable/kilo (2 backports)

Commit 1:

Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

Cherry-Picked from: 3d483fda709d2d04db2222e0119eaa54de5f5867

Commit 2:

Fix mock use for mock 1.1.0

Correct the way we check the calls by using the proper mock method. Add
a new test to expand coverage of the area being fixed.

Cherry-Picked from c7b31385ac3616060ef0f2188fb724191caad03c

Related-Bug: #1488456

Change-Id: I52dcf12be11bb57a47235735f7b46aafdf602261

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 23:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/media.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_live_migration.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/storage.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/live_migration.py'], 'message': "WIP: Propagate nova context through FeedTasks

(Need to figure out how to UT this.)

Bug 1487535 complains that the nova security context is not being
propagated down into TaskFlow Tasks running in parallel engines (i.e.
separate threads).  The immediately-noticeable result is that log
messages don't include the expected request ID.

The main use of parallel TaskFlow engines in nova-powervm is via
pypowervm FeedTasks.  This change set gets the context propagated down
into all instances of FeedTask, which should address the problem for
most or all current code paths.

More work needs to be done, however, to ensure that other Tasks, which
may eventually run in a separate thread, also get their context set
properly.

Depends on pypowervm change in branch bug/1487535.

Change-Id: Icb24084d7395382306df782237c7808b830d90c9
Closes-Bug: 1487535
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Propagate nova context through FeedTasks

(Need to figure out how to UT this.)

Bug 1487535 complains that the nova security context is not being
propagated down into TaskFlow Tasks running in parallel engines (i.e.
separate threads).  The immediately-noticeable result is that log
messages don't include the expected request ID.

The main use of parallel TaskFlow engines in nova-powervm is via
pypowervm FeedTasks.  This change set gets the context propagated down
into all instances of FeedTask, which should address the problem for
most or all current code paths.

More work needs to be done, however, to ensure that other Tasks, which
may eventually run in a separate thread, also get their context set
properly.

Depends on pypowervm change in branch bug/1487535.

Change-Id: Icb24084d7395382306df782237c7808b830d90c9
Closes-Bug: 1487535

commit_message:
Remove CONFIG_STRATEGY prefix

We no longer have CONFIG_INTERNAL and moving forward CONFIG_STRATEGY
infront of COPY_ALWAYS or COPY_ONCE will just lead to confusion.

Change-Id: Ie0d71637e25cbd79d46e1cdca62df714c10b85d2
Implements: blueprint update-configs

commit_message:
Add category list pagination support

Pagination was added to the 'Manage->Categories' page.

For getting category list 'catalog/categories' is used
everywhere. Before there were places where 'catalog/packages/categories' used.
This call is deprecated.

Also added handle of BadRequest error to common exception handler,
so if invalid sort key is passed, dashboard will stay alive.

Change-Id: I80758dce32fc3930250f8924d3243a7a1cdbda80
Related-bug: #1474932

commit_message:
Add services ports to AllowConnect in Apache

OSTF needs to check services via HTTPS. To achieve this,
extra ports were added to Apache proxy:

* 5000 - keystone
* 8000, 8003, 8004 - heat
* 8080 - ceph radosgw (or swift)
* 8082 - murano
* 8386 - sahara
* 8773, 8774 - nova
* 8776 - cinder
* 8777 - ceilometer
* 9292 - glance
* 9696 - neutron

Closes-Bug: #1489408
Change-Id: If599d8eead56d340583e46602373f7ddb2842b00

subject: Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 11:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api/zaqar.transport.wsgi.app.rst'], 'message': "Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app

We've been generating docs for the `zaqar.transport.wsgi.app` module,
which tries to create an instance of the wsgi transport, which then
tries to create an instance of the data controller and connect to the
database.

This module does not contain any docs and we shouldn't require a running
DB instance to generate these docs.

Change-Id: Id1c3cabc61a790bc0e5cccb22e660c933788ded8
Closes-bug: #1489426
"}]
commit_message:
Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app

We've been generating docs for the `zaqar.transport.wsgi.app` module,
which tries to create an instance of the wsgi transport, which then
tries to create an instance of the data controller and connect to the
database.

This module does not contain any docs and we shouldn't require a running
DB instance to generate these docs.

Change-Id: Id1c3cabc61a790bc0e5cccb22e660c933788ded8
Closes-bug: #1489426

subject: Update from global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-24 00:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', '.gitreview', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update from global requirements

This syncs up the requirements with global-requirements on stable/juno.

We need this to cap the dependency on futures to avoid a conflict
with capped futures in the version of taskflow in stable/juno, otherwise
setting up devstack with cinder enabled fails.

Also update .gitreview for stable/juno since this is the first patch
on the new branch.

Also sets up the tox func target, which is basically a cherry pick of
commit 8aff0bda9c35ab96146f4f419803e62710ab5618. Note that while we
make it possible to run the functional tests, we exclude them in
Jenkins runs since they are also excluded from stable/kilo due to
instability in the gate.

Depends-On: I5a2d3f7860aeae6bf442e9372286eedbc290d6a8

Change-Id: I507aade31da19be71900b81880cd5568b351663e
Partial-Bug: #1486576
'}]
commit_message:
Update from global requirements

This syncs up the requirements with global-requirements on stable/juno.

We need this to cap the dependency on futures to avoid a conflict
with capped futures in the version of taskflow in stable/juno, otherwise
setting up devstack with cinder enabled fails.

Also update .gitreview for stable/juno since this is the first patch
on the new branch.

Also sets up the tox func target, which is basically a cherry pick of
commit 8aff0bda9c35ab96146f4f419803e62710ab5618. Note that while we
make it possible to run the functional tests, we exclude them in
Jenkins runs since they are also excluded from stable/kilo due to
instability in the gate.

Depends-On: I5a2d3f7860aeae6bf442e9372286eedbc290d6a8

Change-Id: I507aade31da19be71900b81880cd5568b351663e
Partial-Bug: #1486576

commit_message:
Refactor action constructor

An action has two mandatory parameters in its constructor, 'target' and
'action'. This patch makes 'target' an positional argument for the
constructor.

Change-Id: I798cc498f909f352ca7c443b0bc07afd83c73b69

commit_message:
Refactor _supports_bind method

This commit just makes the logic for _support_bind a little
easier to understand. It also makes it so that the BaseProvider is raising
the NotImplemented exception if a specific provider doesn't support bind
authentication. Instead, each token provider should just return True or False
if it supports bind authentication.

commit_message:
Update NetApp cDOT Manila drivers to use netapp_lib

Like other vendors, NetApp has published a storage controller
client library to PyPI for use by its OpenStack drivers.  This
patch updates the NetApp cDOT Manila drivers to use the new
library.  In particular, the unit tests must still work in the
gate in the absence of the new library.

Implements bp: use-pypi-client-library-in-netapp-cdot-drivers
Change-Id: I362f7ea584bb15a39c761fb5114391f557506764

2015-08-26 10:00:50.277 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-bcb74e98-5a8c-4113-8a43-8a7703502cde None None] Bridge br-ex for physical network public does not exist. Agent terminated!

commit_message:
Revert "Set datapath to $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE for bridges"

This commit breaks my DevStack - the neutron q-agent fails to start with
the following error:

2015-08-26 10:00:50.277 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-bcb74e98-5a8c-4113-8a43-8a7703502cde None None] Bridge br-ex for physical network public does not exist. Agent terminated!

The commit that added $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE failed to set a sane default,
and no documentation for what are recommended values should be set for
$OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE. This was a failue on my part when reviewing the
original path.

This reverts commit d4c89289f9d4bf88c065dca85a46c9b08464b56c.

Change-Id: I848b14f546f60158fb5b2d47c5fa170f6a3ed44f

nova isn't configured as available. The compute tests all require nova
but this skip check was missing for whatever reason.

commit_message:
Catch OverQuota in volume create function

Volume API may raise OverQuota exception to nova API
layer, so nova volume API should catch it and raise
HTTPForbidden just like other API.

according to new rule on the footnote[1] of following doc
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/api_microversion_dev.rst
no microversion will be used for this change.

Closes-Bug: 1444559

Change-Id: Ia782ab9d9a31d37854606f7be82582de6d7bc374

subject: Fix volume backup import test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 19:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volumes_backup.py', 'tempest/services/volume/json/backups_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

This test would fail for incremental backups (which we are not using in
the test) and back-ends that require the ID to be preserved (which are
already skipping this test), so there's no problem.

I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5
Related-Bug: #1476416 Change-Id:
I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5

Change-Id: Ia5b44007c98b8db5492d5eff9778d648e8493507
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

This test would fail for incremental backups (which we are not using in
the test) and back-ends that require the ID to be preserved (which are
already skipping this test), so there's no problem.

I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5
Related-Bug: #1476416 Change-Id:
I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5

Change-Id: Ia5b44007c98b8db5492d5eff9778d648e8493507

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-08-24 15:51:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/objects/image_meta.py'], 'message': "objects: add missing enum values to DiskBus field

This adds the 'lxc' and 'uml' values to the DiskBus enum field. These
are checked in nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.get_dev_prefix_for_disk_bus
so they should be defined in the enum field.

Note that there is no object compat shim for this change since before
ImageMetaProps, the image metadata properties could have any key/value
pairs, including whatever was used for disk_bus which may or may not
have been validated by the virt driver.  With the introduction of the
ImageMetaProps object, if some image properties have 'lxc' or 'uml'
disk_bus values we'll get a ValueError trying to construct the object
since those values aren't in the DiskBus enum field until this change.
There isn't compat logic to backport since that would mean going back
to the broken state and not allowing 'lxc' or 'uml' disk_bus values,
even though they were valid before ImageMetaProps was added.  Plus the
DiskBus enum field isn't versioned, so it's not like an older version
of ImageMetaProps with hw_cdrom_bus='lxc' won't work and we have to
check for it.

Closes-Bug: #1471953

Change-Id: I1060925d074f5de46c07101d7af5471fd12390cd
"}]
commit_message:
objects: add missing enum values to DiskBus field

This adds the 'lxc' and 'uml' values to the DiskBus enum field. These
are checked in nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.get_dev_prefix_for_disk_bus
so they should be defined in the enum field.

Note that there is no object compat shim for this change since before
ImageMetaProps, the image metadata properties could have any key/value
pairs, including whatever was used for disk_bus which may or may not
have been validated by the virt driver.  With the introduction of the
ImageMetaProps object, if some image properties have 'lxc' or 'uml'
disk_bus values we'll get a ValueError trying to construct the object
since those values aren't in the DiskBus enum field until this change.
There isn't compat logic to backport since that would mean going back
to the broken state and not allowing 'lxc' or 'uml' disk_bus values,
even though they were valid before ImageMetaProps was added.  Plus the
DiskBus enum field isn't versioned, so it's not like an older version
of ImageMetaProps with hw_cdrom_bus='lxc' won't work and we have to
check for it.

Closes-Bug: #1471953

Change-Id: I1060925d074f5de46c07101d7af5471fd12390cd

removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['network'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute networks_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I953c9daf10e8b0d07f6999fd4a61330222c1d2e5
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib
"}]
commit_message:
Return complete response from compute networks_client

Currently compute networks_client returns Response by
removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['network'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute networks_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I953c9daf10e8b0d07f6999fd4a61330222c1d2e5
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Fix remote_consoles microversion 2.8 not to run on /v3

Currently remote console tests for version 2.8 runs on /v3 as _api_version
was mentioned as 'v3'.

This commit makes those tests run on v2.1 as other microversion tests runs.

Later v3 endpoint will be removed from api_paste.ini.

Partially implements blueprint test-collapse-v2-and-v21

Change-Id: I7a7bdb34e4118170d97fcdfb78a5ca68b5cfd51a

path). Rather, we should nil these out at the end of the build

commit_message:
Nil out inst.host and inst.node when build fails

This patch addresses a bug that leaves instance.host/node set after
a VM fails to build or reschedule (e.g., due to an error in the spawn
path). Rather, we should nil these out at the end of the build
process so that the instance is not erroneously being associated
with stale host/node information.

Also included are a few cosmetic updates in comments and eliminating
some implied 'None' parameters from "dict.get(key, None)" calls I
found during the course of investigating this change.

Change-Id: I4d9c90b1d3fcce5237323fffcc6db1fb93d23e37
Closes-Bug: #1427944

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-20 18:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['pkg/elasticsearch.sh'], 'message': 'do not redefine path in elasticsearch

in I0272d56bc2e50e8174db78bd449f65f60f7f4000, we reset DEST value

not always correct in gate causing the path to be wrong and

commit_message:
do not redefine path in elasticsearch

in I0272d56bc2e50e8174db78bd449f65f60f7f4000, we reset DEST value
when installing elasticsearch. it gets set to /opt/stack/ which is
not always correct in gate causing the path to be wrong and
elasticseach cannot be installed. we should reuse DEST from stackrc

Change-Id: Ia3a2383ada30c4e92c37386aedd6164c69cac60a
Closes-Bug: #1484182

commit_message:
New db api method instance_get_all_by_grantee_security_groups()

In order to reduce the number of db calls made during security group
rules refresh, thsi introduces a new db api method that with a single
db call accomplishes what currently needs n db calls equal to the
number of security_groups an instance has plus n db calls equal to
the set of rules found for those security groups.

A follow up patch will make use of this to add a new method to the
instance object, which later will be used to replace existing db
calls in compute api trigger_members_refresh().

Related to blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: I8370ccb71c871f169f8235a9d188aac059573880

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if changes-since is
being used and the marker is a deleted server. When trying to

Fixes the bug by passing read_deleted to context when getting

commit_message:
Make pagination work with changes-since and deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if changes-since is
being used and the marker is a deleted server. When trying to
get servers with changes-since and marker, a "BadRequest" error
saying that the marker is not found will be raised.

Fixes the bug by passing read_deleted to context when getting
server to enable to get deleted server as marker.

Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086
Signed-off-by: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6e54bd01a8d45ee0b1618724c4cbefc011c079f9
modified: add test

commit_message:
Move wait_for_server_termination from servers_client

wait_for_server_termination of compute client is just a wrapper.
So the method seems redundant and it doesn't fit as service clients.

This patch moves wait_for_server_termination to waiters module which
contains similar methods.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib738ad91bb5e7344b6a342f23f867df42b833608

commit_message:
Add test for volume-backed instance with certain flavor

Volume-backed instances should not pay attention to flavor disk
attribute, because flavor.disk means size of host local disk space
allocated for instance's root disk, but volume-backed instances do not
use host disk space for their root volumes.

This patch adds tests which boot volume-backed instances by various ways
with flavor.disk smaller than their root volumes.

# min_size=0: Depends-On: I8f35a46069ef4bbb320d1516405e4942843b12fa
# avoid check:
Depends-On: I264493172da20b664df571e32876030246c2a87c
Change-Id: If57a936063ec866f14beca7deafafb2222fc629c

revisions:

tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate

therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff

commit_message:
Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

commit_message:
Enable db migration head check

adds a check to pep8 to verify that the migration chain is correct.
The mismatch between HEAD file and the actual db migration head
happened in VPNaaS repo and it is useful to check this in pep8.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-24 16:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Rudimentary support for influxdb in devstack plugin

This is bare bones and gets the job done without too much
complexity. It relies, for the time being, on the influxdb
distributors not changing their paths and us keeping those paths up
to date.

The packages provided by influxdb are used because the packags from
the distros are currently too old. Because we are using these weird
packages, the service start and stop handling for influxdb is a bit
strange. When the distros are up to date, the _gnocchi_install_influxdb
function should be updated.

Note that influxdb is running _without_ access control.

Closes-Bug: #1481830
Change-Id: If5b3f05c9e4044efd2a5e4c5b7231d0b5856d9ca
'}]
commit_message:
Rudimentary support for influxdb in devstack plugin

This is bare bones and gets the job done without too much
complexity. It relies, for the time being, on the influxdb
distributors not changing their paths and us keeping those paths up
to date.

The packages provided by influxdb are used because the packags from
the distros are currently too old. Because we are using these weird
packages, the service start and stop handling for influxdb is a bit
strange. When the distros are up to date, the _gnocchi_install_influxdb
function should be updated.

Note that influxdb is running _without_ access control.

Closes-Bug: #1481830
Change-Id: If5b3f05c9e4044efd2a5e4c5b7231d0b5856d9ca

subject: Split option discovery function by middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 10:06:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api.rst', 'doc/source/cors.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_opts.py', 'setup.cfg', 'oslo_middleware/opts.py'], 'message': 'Split option discovery function by middleware

Create separate option discovery functions for each piece of middleware,
so an application that only uses one piece can include only those
options in its sample configuration file.

Test the results with some unit tests that simply ensure the functions
do not raise exceptions, and by adding configuration options to the
documentation for the library, using the new integration of oslo.config
with sphinx.

Change-Id: I4c777cd70c063441f430c48ab1f9c9cac2c1fc75
'}]
commit_message:
Split option discovery function by middleware

Create separate option discovery functions for each piece of middleware,
so an application that only uses one piece can include only those
options in its sample configuration file.

Test the results with some unit tests that simply ensure the functions
do not raise exceptions, and by adding configuration options to the
documentation for the library, using the new integration of oslo.config
with sphinx.

Change-Id: I4c777cd70c063441f430c48ab1f9c9cac2c1fc75

subject: Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': 'Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

commit_message:
Marking the login_url option as "deprecated_for_removal"

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212239 has been successfully
merged and now we don't need the login_url option because only
the dashboard_url option is used in the dashboard test. This patch
is intended to mark CONF.dashboard.login_url as deprecated_for_removal.

Change-Id: I4195478d93da605218fddf9aa896e2804ab442ac

subject: Avoid default quota limit of 10 subnets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-31 19:21:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_routers.py'], 'message': 'Avoid default quota limit of 10 subnets

This test class only fails with no tenant isolation in the gate. The only
reason I can think of for this is that the non-isolated demo tenant has
an extra subnet created by devstack whereas the isolated tenant for this
test class does not. I tried putting addCleanups for the network and subnets
in the for loop but that caused other strange problems.

Change-Id: Ib86d54ee4cf317bb9d93d28fd62f44d738b5efaa
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid default quota limit of 10 subnets

This test class only fails with no tenant isolation in the gate. The only
reason I can think of for this is that the non-isolated demo tenant has
an extra subnet created by devstack whereas the isolated tenant for this
test class does not. I tried putting addCleanups for the network and subnets
in the for loop but that caused other strange problems.

Change-Id: Ib86d54ee4cf317bb9d93d28fd62f44d738b5efaa

subject: Add support for docker-compose
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-03 05:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile', 'docker-compose.yml', 'README.rst'], 'message': "Add support for docker-compose

At pyconau's sprints, I took some time to play with docker-compose and
get Zaqar running in it. These 2 files are everything we need to make
that happen.

The composition is based on 2 images. The first one is the mongodb one,
which is downloaded from DockerHub. The second one is built out of
Zaqar's code.

Look at the `README` for the exact steps to use this.

Change-Id: Ia2ff8dc90f6a4ed669e749fed036a8f88c8627a8
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for docker-compose

At pyconau's sprints, I took some time to play with docker-compose and
get Zaqar running in it. These 2 files are everything we need to make
that happen.

The composition is based on 2 images. The first one is the mongodb one,
which is downloaded from DockerHub. The second one is built out of
Zaqar's code.

Look at the `README` for the exact steps to use this.

Change-Id: Ia2ff8dc90f6a4ed669e749fed036a8f88c8627a8

commit_message:
Remove pypy's check for Zaqar

Zaqar's team has not been focusing on pypy support for at least 2
cycles. Keeping the check jobs around is not necessary and the checks
are non-voting anyway.

Change-Id: Icf412647c6b51c5bfb58968627698eb7d3087c3a

commit_message:
Add an experimental influxdb storage job for gnocchi

The gate-gnocchi-dsvm-functional-* jobs take a storage backend and an
indexer backend as templated values. This change adds an
experimental job using influxdb as the storage backend and mysql as
the indexer.

commit_message:
Exclude gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipa.* from stable/juno

The code that this tests wasn't added until Kilo as part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/ipa-as-default-ramdisk
so it doesn't make sense to test on Juno.

Change-Id: Id9af33cf85ca519f63e5a248384060736386c20c

subject: Really add common exclusion for manuals repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 07:28:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Really add common exclusion for manuals repos

*/source/common/* will only match one path element either side, so
we need to open the glob a little wider to match correctly. It also
appears that the other manuals repos also have source/common as a
symlink, so remove the openstack-manuals guard.

Change-Id: Id6e883ec388d9d5f6d471fa8b23f8e3f2ed1885a
'}]
commit_message:
Really add common exclusion for manuals repos

*/source/common/* will only match one path element either side, so
we need to open the glob a little wider to match correctly. It also
appears that the other manuals repos also have source/common as a
symlink, so remove the openstack-manuals guard.

Change-Id: Id6e883ec388d9d5f6d471fa8b23f8e3f2ed1885a

commit_message:
Renaming & moving Manila-HDFS jobs to check pipeline

This patch renames manila-hdfs job names and moves from

pre_, post_ test_hook.sh files.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-27 07:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Add more logs to rabbitmq get_status function

It's really hard to debug, when get_status() returns $OCF_NOT_RUNNING
only and looses exit code and error output.

Added more logs to avoid of this situation.

Related-Bug: #1488999

Change-Id: Id0999235d7be688f55799e2952fe22e97b678ce7

commit_message:
Add more logs to rabbitmq get_status function

It's really hard to debug, when get_status() returns $OCF_NOT_RUNNING
only and looses exit code and error output.

Added more logs to avoid of this situation.

Related-Bug: #1488999

Change-Id: Id0999235d7be688f55799e2952fe22e97b678ce7

subject: Change DEBUG log in loopingcall to TRACE level log
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-27 09:06:19.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/loopingcall.py'], 'message': 'Change DEBUG log in loopingcall to TRACE level log

The DEBUG log message in _run_loop() method will record every
loopingcall info every interval, that may cause log noise. e.g. In
ceilometer, the partition coordinator will have a fixed interval looping
call every two seconds as default.

Change-Id: I32aa474ece2458aa7cc1a5c271a40f664bf07af2
'}]
commit_message:
Change DEBUG log in loopingcall to TRACE level log

The DEBUG log message in _run_loop() method will record every
loopingcall info every interval, that may cause log noise. e.g. In
ceilometer, the partition coordinator will have a fixed interval looping
call every two seconds as default.

Change-Id: I32aa474ece2458aa7cc1a5c271a40f664bf07af2

subject: Use restorecon over chcon for unbound selinux
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6554, 'name': 'Spencer Krum', 'email': 'nibz@spencerkrum.com', 'username': 'krum-spencer'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 12767, 'name': 'Craige McWhirter', 'email': 'craige@mcwhirter.io', 'username': 'craige'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-19 14:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/99-unbound'], 'message': 'Use restorecon over chcon for unbound selinux

Rather then explicitly forcing a security context for unbound, we
should restore the default selinux contexts defined by the OS.

Change-Id: I4bb21dcbbcbcff6a5458ebf9478f58d95ad7240a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use restorecon over chcon for unbound selinux

Rather then explicitly forcing a security context for unbound, we
should restore the default selinux contexts defined by the OS.

Change-Id: I4bb21dcbbcbcff6a5458ebf9478f58d95ad7240a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Change Ie060ac825bbb9a643240390c635c22f5cc01776d intented to move
python-jobs template as invidual jobs since python27 is non-voting but
forgot to remove the template itself - and forgot to add
networking-ofagent-branch-tarball. Do both changes now to really

commit_message:
Remove extra pyhon-jobs from networking-ofagent

Change Ie060ac825bbb9a643240390c635c22f5cc01776d intented to move
python-jobs template as invidual jobs since python27 is non-voting but
forgot to remove the template itself - and forgot to add
networking-ofagent-branch-tarball. Do both changes now to really
remove non-voting python27 job from gate queue.

Change-Id: I6319b7abd2e26ab6c39ae9ef82009bf81045718d

commit_message:
Remove unneeded neutron services in dsvm-neutron

This job breaks when attempting to start neutron due to issues with the
vpn service. Nodepool does not need the vpn service or the fwaas service
so just remove them.

Change-Id: Iaf010a021f096731cb757155ceb0afcf2830c301

subject: Updates the diversity script for better output
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-27 18:59:52.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tools/diversity.py'], 'message': 'Updates the diversity script for better output

This update makes the diversity script to parse all projects from the
`reference/projects.yaml` file and prettyprint the output. The changes
make it possible to deal with an empty return when inspecting the stats
value from the stackalytics API which is important due to all of the
recent project movement. The script was updated so that its using some
of the additional requests features in ``params`` and is now passing
flake8. Lastly, a requirements.txt file was added for the requirements
in the script.

Change-Id: I277a772b1dcd4035be888b27a1b70ae780691147
'}]
commit_message:
Updates the diversity script for better output

This update makes the diversity script to parse all projects from the
`reference/projects.yaml` file and prettyprint the output. The changes
make it possible to deal with an empty return when inspecting the stats
value from the stackalytics API which is important due to all of the
recent project movement. The script was updated so that its using some
of the additional requests features in ``params`` and is now passing
flake8. Lastly, a requirements.txt file was added for the requirements
in the script.

Change-Id: I277a772b1dcd4035be888b27a1b70ae780691147

subject: VPNaaS: fix create_snat_namespace attribute errors in unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 11:03:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py'], 'message': 'VPNaaS: fix create_snat_namespace attribute errors in unit tests

create_snat_namespace is renamed to _create_snat_namespace in
dvr_edge_router module. So unit tests are failing with attribute
error while accessing create_snat_namespace.

Closes-bug: #1489268
Change-Id: Id312a503b09a5cb43d28f062b4548196a376664d
'}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: fix create_snat_namespace attribute errors in unit tests

create_snat_namespace is renamed to _create_snat_namespace in
dvr_edge_router module. So unit tests are failing with attribute
error while accessing create_snat_namespace.

Closes-bug: #1489268
Change-Id: Id312a503b09a5cb43d28f062b4548196a376664d

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-25 18:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Pre-load expected attrs that the view builder needs for server details

There is a race between getting the instances from the database and
when the view builder shows the details.  If an instance is deleted
before lazy-loading some info, like the flavor, then the view
builder fails with an InstanceNotFound and the request returns a 500
in the v2.1 case and a 404 in the v2 case.

We can have the view builder tell the API code what attributes it
expects when it gets the instance from the database so that we don't
have to do any lazy loading in the view builder.

Change-Id: Ie03ab415baaa9e88c423a1c60a40d53b4cc464c4
Closes-Bug: #1487570
"}]
commit_message:
Pre-load expected attrs that the view builder needs for server details

There is a race between getting the instances from the database and
when the view builder shows the details.  If an instance is deleted
before lazy-loading some info, like the flavor, then the view
builder fails with an InstanceNotFound and the request returns a 500
in the v2.1 case and a 404 in the v2 case.

We can have the view builder tell the API code what attributes it
expects when it gets the instance from the database so that we don't
have to do any lazy loading in the view builder.

Change-Id: Ie03ab415baaa9e88c423a1c60a40d53b4cc464c4
Closes-Bug: #1487570

subject: Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 22:13:57.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile

When performing an upgrade, this project strives to have minimal
downtime for VMs that are running. By removing the apparmor profile as a
precondition for upgrades, when the container create role runs, the
profile will default to contained (the most restrictive profile). This
causes instance downtime since neutron can not create network
namespaces.

Related-bug: 1487130
Closes-bug: 1489144
Change-Id: Ife7aab044c7cb882a89c6b108b2d66f5e39aa10c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove temporary upgrade task that removes profile

When performing an upgrade, this project strives to have minimal
downtime for VMs that are running. By removing the apparmor profile as a
precondition for upgrades, when the container create role runs, the
profile will default to contained (the most restrictive profile). This
causes instance downtime since neutron can not create network
namespaces.

Related-bug: 1487130
Closes-bug: 1489144
Change-Id: Ife7aab044c7cb882a89c6b108b2d66f5e39aa10c

commit_message:
Remove broken workaround code for old mock.

Mock <= 1.0.1 was indeed broken on 3.4, but unittest.mock from 3.4 is
just as (or more) broken. Mock is now fixed, so don't play games with
the global state of the import system.

Change-Id: I5e04b773d33c63d5cf06ff60c321de70de453b69
Closes-Bug: #1488252
Partial-Bug: #1463867

commit_message:
Add cert_uuid attributes to Bay in db

This patch adds two attributes.
1. ca_cert_uuid
2. magnum_cert_uuid

ca_cert_uuid is used for storing CA cert reference, and
magnum_cert_uuid is used for storing client cert reference which is
used by magnum-conductor as a Kubernetes client.

These attributes are not exposed to user.

Change-Id: I510d096abffa238c3a6cb20975f1693f0284747d
Partial-Implements: blueprint magnum-as-a-ca

commit_message:
Use is_superuser instead of hardcode admin role

horizon and openstack can have arbitrary admin roles. We should check
is_superuser, that inspects OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_ADMIN_ROLES instead of
hardcoding admin permission role.

Change-Id: Ibd13ae2c1e3a60fea8a44dcb258e39e3a7fc6d3a
Closes-Bug: #1489035

subject: Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': 'Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls

It used to be that a GET of a tempurl referencing a large object would
let you download that large object regardless of where its segments
lived. However, this led to some violated user expectations around
container tempurls.

(Note on shorthand: all tempurls reference objects. However, "account
tempurl" and "container tempurl" are shorthand meaning tempurls
generated using a key on the account or container, respectively.)

Let's say an application is given tempurl keys to a particular
container, and it does all its work therein using those keys. The user
expects that, if the application is compromised, then the attacker
only gains access to the "compromised-container". However, with the old
behavior, the attacker could read data from *any* container like so:

1) Choose a "victim-container" to download

2) Create PUT and GET tempurl for any object name within the
   "compromised-container". The object doesn't need to exist;
   we'll create it.

3) Using the PUT tempurl, upload a DLO manifest with
   "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/"

4) Using the GET tempurl, download the object created in step 3. The
   result will be the concatenation of all objects in the
   "victim-container".

Step 3 need not be for all objects in the "victim-container"; for
example, a value "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/abc" would only
be the concatenation of all objects whose names begin with "abc". By
probing for object names in this way, individual objects may be found
and extracted.

A similar bug would exist for manifests referencing other accounts
except that neither the X-Object-Manifest (DLO) nor the JSON manifest
document (SLO) have a way of specifying a different account.

This change makes it so that a container tempurl only grants access to
objects within its container, *including* large-object segments. This
breaks backward compatibility for container tempurls that may have
pointed to cross container *LO's, but (a) there are security
implications, and (b) container tempurls are a relatively new feature.

This works by having the tempurl middleware install an authorization
callback ('swift.authorize' in the WSGI environment) that limits the
scope of any requests to the account or container from which the key
came.

This requires swift.authorize to persist for both the manifest request
and all segment requests; this is done by having the proxy server
restore it to the WSGI environment prior to returning from __call__.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clayg@swiftstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: Ie6d52f7a07e87f6fec21ed8b0ec1d84be8b2b11c
Closes-Bug: 1449212
'}]
commit_message:
Better scoping for tempurls, especially container tempurls

It used to be that a GET of a tempurl referencing a large object would
let you download that large object regardless of where its segments
lived. However, this led to some violated user expectations around
container tempurls.

(Note on shorthand: all tempurls reference objects. However, "account
tempurl" and "container tempurl" are shorthand meaning tempurls
generated using a key on the account or container, respectively.)

Let's say an application is given tempurl keys to a particular
container, and it does all its work therein using those keys. The user
expects that, if the application is compromised, then the attacker
only gains access to the "compromised-container". However, with the old
behavior, the attacker could read data from *any* container like so:

1) Choose a "victim-container" to download

2) Create PUT and GET tempurl for any object name within the
   "compromised-container". The object doesn't need to exist;
   we'll create it.

3) Using the PUT tempurl, upload a DLO manifest with
   "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/"

4) Using the GET tempurl, download the object created in step 3. The
   result will be the concatenation of all objects in the
   "victim-container".

Step 3 need not be for all objects in the "victim-container"; for
example, a value "X-Object-Manifest: /victim-container/abc" would only
be the concatenation of all objects whose names begin with "abc". By
probing for object names in this way, individual objects may be found
and extracted.

A similar bug would exist for manifests referencing other accounts
except that neither the X-Object-Manifest (DLO) nor the JSON manifest
document (SLO) have a way of specifying a different account.

This change makes it so that a container tempurl only grants access to
objects within its container, *including* large-object segments. This
breaks backward compatibility for container tempurls that may have
pointed to cross container *LO's, but (a) there are security
implications, and (b) container tempurls are a relatively new feature.

This works by having the tempurl middleware install an authorization
callback ('swift.authorize' in the WSGI environment) that limits the
scope of any requests to the account or container from which the key
came.

This requires swift.authorize to persist for both the manifest request
and all segment requests; this is done by having the proxy server
restore it to the WSGI environment prior to returning from __call__.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clayg@swiftstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Change-Id: Ie6d52f7a07e87f6fec21ed8b0ec1d84be8b2b11c
Closes-Bug: 1449212

subject: Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': 'Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I11e68830009d3f6bff44ae4011a41b67139146f6
Closes-Bug: 1453948
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I11e68830009d3f6bff44ae4011a41b67139146f6
Closes-Bug: 1453948

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-24 14:21:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': "Prevent exception due to missing id of LDAP entity

commit_message:
Prevent exception due to missing id of LDAP entity

There are cases when users get created in AD and don't always have
`user_id_attribute` field populated because it is only a requirement for
Openstack in the environment. When a user does not have a populated
`user_id_attribute`, all keystone queries fail, not just queries or rows
containing that user.

Fix the query to LDAP to fetch only entries that have id assigned.

Change-Id: I0c7de36808ca6081ffc55a188a4583ddb5712bee
Closes-Bug: 1478579

commit_message:
Expose exception due to missing id of LDAP entity

There are cases when users get created in AD and don't always have
`user_id_attribute` field populated because it is only a requirement for
Openstack in the environment. When a user does not have a populated
`user_id_attribute`, all keystone queries fail, not just queries or rows
containing that user.

Show that the exception occurs and get_all fails.

Change-Id: Iac623f3a86d5c55d82d386048b1f908f59193e42
Partial-Bug: 1478579

only suffering from rare timeouts in host setup code.

commit_message:
Bump timeout for ironic-inspector job to usual 2 hours

This job needs to build its ramdisk for source, which makes it much
slower than I originally expected, due to how slow mirrors are sometimes.

This change brings it in sync with other ironic jobs.

Change-Id: Ibd5b9437189ae9409ce47e776db636d7f7b81bc4

commit_message:
Start translation

Create an empty RST file, our scripts will add content to it.
Enable translation via the config file.
Add the usual tools/generate-pot-rst.sh to build pot files.
Add the usual target to tox.ini for RST translation.
We need openstack-doc-tools 0.30 or newer for RST translations.

Change-Id: I9100d663460cd7baa0c09954d17e728c1534a0ee

commit_message:
Scheduler: Move notifier.info to scheduler manager

This patch moves notifer.info from scheduler driver class to manager class,
by doing this, so we don't need to send any notification in drivers.

Besides, this will benifit to outtree drivers.

Closes-Bug: #1483943
Change-Id: I3165024e4735c6e906a21b333a7dc2101ed7e925

Change-Id: I531b689d8958498f625a10992c2593a033a6f175

subject: Remove tiered building in build.py
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-27 08:57:05.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_build.py', 'tox.ini', 'kolla/cmd/build.py'], 'message': "Remove tiered building in build.py

Many tiers have been shed over this issue and frankly enough is enough
on this tiering thing, it's tiering us apart! Now we use threading a
bit better as well.
No more tiers! Puns very much intended.

Additionally, this refactors the function names to make inc0 happier
and be consistent.

We also modify the test_build.py to catch the new statuses introduced
by the regex patch. Then we remove the Ubuntu Source from the Docker
folder test as that will never ever be functional.

Also fixed regex to properly match true regex expressions.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Jastrzebski (inc0) <michal.jastrzebski@intel.com>
Change-Id: I650fd6af76eddb809756762222e66aefd6fc1dca
Partially-Implements: blueprint build-script
"}]
commit_message:
Remove tiered building in build.py

Many tiers have been shed over this issue and frankly enough is enough
on this tiering thing, it's tiering us apart! Now we use threading a
bit better as well.
No more tiers! Puns very much intended.

Additionally, this refactors the function names to make inc0 happier
and be consistent.

We also modify the test_build.py to catch the new statuses introduced
by the regex patch. Then we remove the Ubuntu Source from the Docker
folder test as that will never ever be functional.

Also fixed regex to properly match true regex expressions.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Jastrzebski (inc0) <michal.jastrzebski@intel.com>
Change-Id: I650fd6af76eddb809756762222e66aefd6fc1dca
Partially-Implements: blueprint build-script

subject: Add nova_libvirt_live_migration_flag variable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 07:02:44.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Add nova_libvirt_live_migration_flag variable

Currently live_migration_flag is only written to nova.conf if Ceph is
in use.  However, there may be other use cases using live migrations
where being able to override this is necessary.  This commit introduces
a new variable called nova_libvirt_live_migration_flag and writes
live_migration_flag to nova.conf irrespective of whether Ceph is in
use.  We also relocate nova_libvirt_disk_cachemodes and
nova_libvirt_hw_disk_discard in defaults/main.yml so that these
defaults sit with the other nova_libvirt defaults.

NOTE: We change the live_migration_flag defaults here to match nova's
      defaults.  Several Ceph resources suggest to use
      VIR_MIGRATE_PERSIST_DEST however in my limited testing this did
      not appear to be necessary.  We can update the default or amend
      it when using Ceph if we find that it is in fact necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1484439
Change-Id: I1baa9d590ae90ca45c763c8a5e6546c4825eabfe
(cherry picked from commit b4d468ea22e23126c7924faf68df45598fd08e26)
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova_libvirt_live_migration_flag variable

Currently live_migration_flag is only written to nova.conf if Ceph is
in use.  However, there may be other use cases using live migrations
where being able to override this is necessary.  This commit introduces
a new variable called nova_libvirt_live_migration_flag and writes
live_migration_flag to nova.conf irrespective of whether Ceph is in
use.  We also relocate nova_libvirt_disk_cachemodes and
nova_libvirt_hw_disk_discard in defaults/main.yml so that these
defaults sit with the other nova_libvirt defaults.

NOTE: We change the live_migration_flag defaults here to match nova's
      defaults.  Several Ceph resources suggest to use
      VIR_MIGRATE_PERSIST_DEST however in my limited testing this did
      not appear to be necessary.  We can update the default or amend
      it when using Ceph if we find that it is in fact necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1484439
Change-Id: I1baa9d590ae90ca45c763c8a5e6546c4825eabfe
(cherry picked from commit b4d468ea22e23126c7924faf68df45598fd08e26)

subject: Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:00:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'message': 'Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8

commit_message:
Enable/disable Swift/OpenStack deployment properly

This patch properly enables or disables Ceilometer, general
OpenStack and Swift deployment properly.

For the moment the containers will still be created, but
none of the related software will be installed, configured
or tested.

A fix to limit the containers created will be implemented
after a revision of the haproxy playbook/role to accommodate
this is implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1485945
Implements: blueprint split-aio-gates
Change-Id: Ia6657a02a6d1c53a4d76d7a17f74748ec9d2a2ee

commit_message:
Register SSL cert in Java keystore to access to swift via SSL

We need to specify location of ca certificate file, because of
authentication error, during working Sahara with SwiftFS.

Change-Id: I69aca6ed07db2352f43efeee8108c2db9e22f24d
Related-bug: #1487912
